snippet: Mohamed ElBaradei, Egypt’s most prominent liberal, said he told Western leaders that the forced removal of President Mohamed Morsi was necessary.
abstract: Mohamed ElBaradei, Egypt's most prominent liberal, says he had worked hard to convince Western powers of what he calls necessity of forcibly ousting Pres Mohamed Morsi; says Morsi had bungled country's transition to an inclusive democracy.
lead_paragraph: Mohamed ElBaradei, Egypt’s most prominent liberal, said he told Western leaders that the forced removal of President Mohamed Morsi was necessary.

headline.main: Prominent Egyptian Liberal Says He Sought West’s Support for Uprising
headline.print_headline: Prominent Egyptian Liberal Says He Sought West’s Support for Uprising
